definitions.definition: A form of isomerism in which atoms are arranged differently about a chiral centre (or centre of asymmetry ). They exhibit optical activity , and in a molecule with a single chiral centre the two isomers ( enantiomers ) are mirror images of each other whereas in a molecule with multiple chiral centres the isomers ( diastereoisomers ) are not normally mirror images.

main_definition: ( chemistry ) A form of isomerism in which atoms are arranged differently about a chiral centre (or centre of asymmetry ). They exhibit optical activity , and in a molecule with a single chiral centre the two isomers ( enantiomers ) are mirror images of each other whereas in a molecule with multiple chiral centres the isomers ( diastereoisomers ) are not normally mirror images.
